sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Cotta to Schenker, dated August 30, 1906
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: [NMTP I = Harmonielehre:] Remaining gatherings will reach Schenker in next two weeks; urges speed, avoidance of long insertions, predicts mid-October publication.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Cotta, J. G.; Schenker, Heinrich; NMTP; Harmonielehre; Theory of Harmony; proofs; gatherings; insertions; publication

tei:transcription.tei:p: Handwritten letter from Cotta to Schenker, dated August 30, 1906 = CA 37| CA 37 = Cotta’s carbon copy (it has a number ending in “5” written in crayon, but most is cut off on photocopy).

Wir beehren uns, Ihnen höfl. mitzuteilen, daß die Korrektur der letzten Bogen Ihres Buches The last gatherings referred to are 17-20, in CA 34, August 18, so the remaining gatherings are likely to be 21–29 = pp.321–452. ”Theorien und Phantasien” Ihnen im Laufe der nächsten vierzehn Tage zugehen wird. Sie wurden uns nun zu dank verpflichten, wenn Sie die Bogen immer recht bald erledigen wollten, damit der Druck schnell erfolgen kann. Wenn es irgend möglich ist, bitten wir größere Zusätze zu vermeiden, CA 18, April 2, referred to insertions of commentaries between music examples; CA 22, May 16, enclosed “a major quantity of new manuscript”; and the present letter is being written against the background of the “Afterword” having expanded from one gathering to “seven or eight,” so Cotta may have felt reason to be concerned about continued additions to the volume. da in diesem Falle stets Neuumbruch nötig ist und {2} eine Verzögerung zur Folge hat. Es liegt uns hohe daran, daß das Buch Mitte Oktober erscheint, und wir wären Ihnen dankbar, wenn Sie uns unterstützten, dies zu erreichen.
Mit vorzügliche Hochachtung Ihr sehr ergebenen [signed:] J. G. Cottasche Buchhandlung Nachf.

tei:translation.tei:p: Handwritten letter from Cotta to Schenker, dated August 30, 1906 = CA 37|

We have the honor of informing you that the proofs of the final gatherings of your book Theories and Fantasies will reach you in the course of the next two weeks. We should be greatly obliged if you would deal with these gatherings as quickly as possible so that printing can go ahead quickly [thereafter]. If at all possible, we ask you to refrain from making large-scale additions, since in this event a new page make-up is always necessary and {2} a delay results. We are concerned that the book appear in mid-October, and we should be grateful to you if you would assist us in achieving this.
With kind regards, Yours very truly, [signed:] Heirs of J. G. Cotta’s Bookdealership
